newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian rail workers to stage new strike Dec 28.
newsitem.headline: Croatian rail workers to stage new strike Dec 28.

text.p: Croatian rail workers, who have just ended a three-week-long stoppage, plan to strike again on December 28, the state news agency HINA quoted the HZ railway management as saying.
The loss-making state railway said the union's demands were unchanged.
Some 11,000 HZ workers went on strike on November 28. They stopped all passenger and cargo trains to press demands for higher wages and better working conditions.
They called off the strike on Tuesday, after the Supreme Court rejected the union's appeal to reconsider its previous ruling which proclaimed the stoppage illegal.

The HZ management statement said it would sue the union for damages caused by the stoppage and fire 24 organisers of the strike. It said the damages were about 20 million kuna ($3.6 million) and 300,000 ECU.
HZ said earlier it risked being unable to pay the workers' November wages. On Wednesday it said wages had been paid but some 3,000 strikers received only 20 percent of their salaries.
"There are no reasons for a new strike," the HZ statement said and called upon the Union to reconsider its threat.
The government is expected to spend more than one billion kuna (some $200 million) in 1996 alone to subsidize Croatian Railways (Hrvatske Zeljeznice).
